letters.description: Gather comprehensive data on the child's sleep habits, routines, and environment through questionnaires, sleep diaries, and parent interviews. Summarize key findings and identify potential contributing factors.

Actively listen to the parents' concerns, perspectives, and goals. Learn about their parenting style, values, and any previous sleep interventions attempted. Identify any underlying medical or developmental issues.
Provide evidence-based education on infant and child sleep physiology, healthy sleep habits, and safe sleep practices. Empower parents with knowledge and strategies to make informed decisions.
Collaboratively establish a personalized sleep plan tailored to the child's age, developmental stage, and family's preferences. Execute the plan with consistent implementation and ongoing support.

Monitor progress, address challenges, and adjust the sleep plan as needed. Persist with consistent support and encouragement to help families achieve their sleep goals and establish long-term healthy sleep habits.
